item.title: SAFE Crossroads Podcast #33, Alpha Release
item.description:
SAFE Crossroads Podcast #33, Alpha Release

In this Episode We have a chat with Francis Brunelle, a returning guest, about the recent Alpha Release of the MaidSafe Client, and a lot more about the state and progress of the SAFE Network project. Magic Word Listen for the magic word, and submit it to your LetsTalkBitcoin.com account to claim a share of this week's listener award distribution of LTBcoin.

item.title: What is a hash pre-image as it is used for the breach remedy?
item.description:
What is a hash pre-image as it is used for the breach remedy?

Until this afternoon I thought the anti-cheat transactions or breach remedies built on the exit-transaction of the counterparty. Apparently, they build on something called a "hash pre-image". What...

item.title: Bitcoin naysers are wrong, says former SEC chief | News.Markets
item.description:
Bitcoin naysers are wrong, says former SEC chief | News.Markets

Those predicting its imminent demise are mistaken, says Levitt. A former chairman of the US Securities and Exchange Commission has launched a stout defence of the bitcoin virtual currency against those who forecast that it is certain to fail. Writing in American Banker, Arthur Levitt says: "Naysayers love to nay.

item.title: Hacking Group Claims It Dumped NSA-Linked Files, Demands One Million BTC
item.description:
Hacking Group Claims It Dumped NSA-Linked Files, Demands One Million BTC

A hacking group called The Shadow Brokers has claimed to have hacked a group linked to the National Security Agency (NSA) and is asking for 1 million bitcoins ($568 million) to return files after having dumped some of the files, according to Motherboard.

item.title: Plane Maker Airbus Joins Hyperledger Blockchain Project - CoinDesk
item.description:
Plane Maker Airbus Joins Hyperledger Blockchain Project - CoinDesk

French airplane manufacturer Airbus has joined the Hyperledger Project, the Linux Foundation-led blockchain initiative begun earlier this year. The Toulouse-based manufacturer, which last year beat Boeing to sell more than 1,000 aircraft, is expected to "actively contribute" to the initiative, which also counts companies such as IBM, Intel and JPMorgan among its membership.

item.title: How is Bitcoin Actually Stolen? Theft Prevention
item.description:
How is Bitcoin Actually Stolen? Theft Prevention

The successful US$65 million dollar hacking attack launched on the Bitfinex trading platform left the community to question the security measures of the multi-signature technology implemented by the exchange. It also triggered a relatively simple yet important argument; how is Bitcoin actually stolen? To begin with, let's tackle the fundamentals of the security breach of Bitfinex.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Stop Loss Hit! - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Stop Loss Hit! - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this evening. The markets have just about drawn to a close now out of Europe, and once again we had a pretty active day in the bitcoin price.

item.title: Is the Bitcoin Price in for a Massive Bull Run? - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Is the Bitcoin Price in for a Massive Bull Run? - Bitcoinist.net

Following a heavy drop, the bitcoin price showed signs of recovery last week when it ascended to $590. Now, bitcoin has dropped again and is hovering around $580 at press time. Also read: Silk Road Auction Could Help Bitcoin Price Bounce Back Bitcoin has likely found a comfortable place to reside for the time being.
